cookie.text.a: We use cookies for analytics to understand site usage. See the
cookies.p.analytics_cookies.1: If you accept analytics cookies, Google Analytics may set cookies on your device. These cookies help us understand usage trends such as approximate location (country/region), device type, and pages visited.
cookies.p.analytics_cookies.2: If you do not consent, analytics scripts are not loaded and analytics cookies are not set.
cookies.p.changes_to_this_policy.1: We may update this Cookie Policy from time to time. Any changes will be reflected by the Last updated date at the top of this page.
cookies.p.contact.1a: If you have questions about this Cookie Policy, please use the
cookies.p.how_we_use_cookies.1: If you consent, we use cookies to measure aggregated website usage. These measurements help us understand which pages are visited and how the site performs, so we can improve the experience.
cookies.p.how_we_use_cookies.2: We do not use cookies for advertising, profiling, or selling data to third parties.
cookies.p.managing_your_preferences.1: You can manage cookie consent through the banner shown when you first visit the website. You can also change your choice at any time by opening Cookie settings .
cookies.p.managing_your_preferences.2: You can also control cookies through your browser settings. Most browsers allow you to block cookies, delete existing cookies, or configure site-level permissions. Note that blocking all cookies may affect analytics measurement but should not prevent QR code generation.
cookies.p.overview.1: This website uses cookies only for analytics purposes and only if you choose to accept them. You can change your cookie preference at any time via Cookie settings in the footer.
cookies.p.strictly_necessary_cookies.1: This website does not intentionally set strictly necessary cookies for normal operation. In some cases, our hosting provider (Cloudflare) may set a short-lived security cookie when protecting the site against malicious traffic. These cookies are used for security and are not used for advertising.
cookies.p.what_cookies_are.1: Cookies are small text files stored on your device by your browser. They can be used to remember preferences, enable core functionality, or measure how a website is used.
cookies.subtitle: How cookies and similar technologies are used on this website.
cookies.title: Cookie Policy - Free QR Code Generator
faq.a1: A QR code is a two-dimensional barcode that can be read by smartphone cameras and QR scanner apps. It stores information in a square pattern, which can represent text, a website link, contact details, and more. QR codes are popular because they are fast to scan and can hold more information than classic barcodes.
faq.a10a: A static QR code stores the final information directly in the code and cannot be changed after creation. It is free, simple, and reliable long term. A dynamic QR code uses a redirect, allowing the destination to be updated later and often providing scan analytics, but it depends on a third-party service. For more details, see the
faq.a11: No. This website generates QR codes entirely in your browser. The data you enter is not stored, uploaded, or processed on a server. QR codes are generated client-side only, which means your information stays on your device.
faq.a12: No personal data is sold or shared with third parties. This website does not collect personal information from QR code content. If analytics are enabled, they are used only to understand general site usage and improve the service, not to identify individuals.
faq.a2: A QR code stores data as a grid of dark and light squares. When you scan it, the camera reads the pattern and converts it back into data, such as a URL or a contact card. QR codes also include error correction, which helps scanners recover the data even if the code is slightly dirty or partially covered.
faq.a3: Capacity depends on the QR version and the type of content. As a rough guide, QR codes can store thousands of characters. Numeric content can store more than text. In practice, shorter payloads scan faster and more reliably, so it is usually best to keep the encoded content concise.
faq.a4: Many industries are moving toward 2D codes because they can hold more information and can be used both by checkout systems and by consumers. Standards like GS1 Digital Link also make it possible for one code to serve multiple purposes, such as product identification plus a link to extra details.
faq.a5: Not at all. QR codes continue to expand into new use cases, including payments, menus, access control, marketing, and quick information sharing. They are simple, widely supported, and still evolving with modern standards.
faq.a6: A safe minimum is about 3 cm by 3 cm, which is around 1 inch by 1 inch. If you are unsure, printing larger is usually better than printing smaller, especially if scanning happens from a distance.
faq.a7: Vector format such as SVG can scale to any size without becoming blurry. This is ideal for print because it stays sharp on everything from small labels to large posters.
faq.a8: Often yes. QR codes include error correction, which can recover data even when part of the pattern is missing. How much damage is recoverable depends on how much of the code is affected and how strong the error correction is. If you use QR codes for print, it helps to keep a clean quiet zone around the code and use strong contrast.
faq.a9: Yes, as long as there is enough contrast between the code and the background. Many scanners rely on strong contrast, so you should test across multiple phones and lighting conditions. For reliable scanning, dark code on a light background is still the safest choice.
faq.q10: What is the difference between static and dynamic QR codes?
faq.q11: Does this website store personal data?
faq.q12: Is any data sold or shared with third parties?
faq.q3: What is the maximum data capacity of a QR code?
faq.q4: Will QR codes replace traditional barcodes?
faq.q6: What is the recommended minimum size for a printed QR code?
faq.q7: What is the best file type for printing?
faq.q8: Can QR codes still work if they are partially damaged?
faq.q9: Is it possible to have a white QR code?
faq.title: Frequently asked questions

privacy.p.changes_to_this_statement.1: We may update this Privacy Statement from time to time. Any changes will be reflected by the Last updated date at the top of this page.
privacy.p.children.1: This website is not intended for children under the age of 16, and we do not knowingly collect personal data from children.
privacy.p.contact_form.1: When you submit the contact form, the information you provide is used solely to respond to your inquiry. Contact messages are not used for marketing or profiling.
privacy.p.contact_form.2: This Privacy Statement will be updated when backend processing is introduced, including details on transmission and retention.
privacy.p.cookies_and_analytics.1: Cookies are used only for analytics purposes and only if you choose to accept them. Analytics help us understand aggregated usage, such as page views and device types.
privacy.p.cookies_and_analytics.2: You can find more information in the Cookie Policy and manage your preferences at any time via Cookie settings in the footer.
privacy.p.hosting_and_security.1: The website is hosted on Cloudflare Pages. Cloudflare may process limited technical data, such as IP address and request metadata, to deliver content securely and to protect against malicious traffic.
privacy.p.legal_basis.1: Analytics data is processed based on your consent. Technical data required to operate and secure the website is processed based on legitimate interests. Contact form data is processed to respond to your request.
privacy.p.overview.1: This website provides a free QR code generator that runs entirely in your browser. We aim to minimize data collection and to be transparent about how information is processed.
privacy.p.overview.2: QR codes are generated client-side. The content you enter into the generator is not automatically transmitted to or stored by us.
privacy.p.overview.3: Analytics are used only to understand general site usage and only after you give consent.
privacy.p.qr_code_data.1: Information entered into the QR generator, such as website URLs, text, Wi‑Fi credentials, or vCard details, is processed locally in your browser to generate a QR code. We do not receive this information as part of normal operation.
privacy.p.who_we_are.1a: We operate this website to provide tools for creating static QR codes. If you have questions about this Privacy Statement or how data is handled, please use the
privacy.p.your_rights.1: Depending on your location, you may have rights to access, correct, or delete your data, and to withdraw consent for analytics at any time. Requests can be made via the Contact page.
privacy.subtitle: How we handle data when you use this website.
privacy.title: Privacy Statement - Free QR Code Generator

qrApplications.subtitle: Below are real-life examples of how QR codes are used every day.
staticVsDynamic.coffee.text: If this guide helped you, consider buying me a coffee
staticVsDynamic.h2.dynamicWhat: What is a dynamic QR code?
staticVsDynamic.h2.staticWhat: What is a static QR code?
staticVsDynamic.p.choose.1: Choose a static QR code if you want something simple, free, and reliable. Static QR codes are a good fit for permanent content such as a homepage, product information page, menu PDF, or Wi‑Fi details that will not change.
staticVsDynamic.p.choose.2: Choose a dynamic QR code if you plan to change the destination later or if you want scan analytics. Dynamic QR codes are often used in marketing campaigns, printed ads, product packaging, and event materials.
staticVsDynamic.p.dynamicWhat.1: A dynamic QR code usually stores a short redirect link instead of the final destination. When someone scans it, they first open the redirect, and then they are sent to the final destination.
staticVsDynamic.p.dynamicWhat.2: Because the destination is managed on a server, you can change where the QR code points later without changing the QR image. Many dynamic QR services also provide scan analytics.
staticVsDynamic.p.staticWhat.1: A static QR code contains the final information inside the code itself. For example, if you create a QR code for https://example.com, that exact link is encoded in the QR code.
staticVsDynamic.p.staticWhat.2: Once printed or shared, a static QR code cannot be changed. If you need to update the link or content, you must create a new QR code and replace the old one.
staticVsDynamic.p.using.1: This website generates static QR codes. They run in your browser and do not expire. If you need a dynamic QR code, you can use a dedicated dynamic QR provider or set up your own redirect link.
staticVsDynamic.subtitle: A simple guide to help you choose the right type for your use case.
staticVsDynamic.table.note: Dynamic QR codes often require a subscription for editing and analytics.
staticVsDynamic.table.row.changeDest: Can you change the destination later?

terms.p.acceptable_use.1: You agree not to use the website for unlawful, harmful, or abusive purposes. This includes generating QR codes that link to malicious content, phishing pages, malware, or content that violates the rights of others.
terms.p.acceptable_use.2: You agree not to attempt to disrupt, overload, or interfere with the website, including by automated scraping, attacks, or other misuse.
terms.p.availability.1: We aim to keep the website available, but we do not guarantee uninterrupted access. The website may change, be suspended, or be discontinued at any time.
terms.p.changes_to_these_terms.1: We may update these Terms from time to time. Continued use of the website after changes means you accept the updated Terms. The Last updated date at the top shows when changes were made.

terms.p.disclaimer.1: The website is provided “as is” and “as available” without warranties of any kind. We do not guarantee that QR codes will scan in every environment or that encoded content will be compatible with every device or app.
terms.p.intellectual_property.1: The website design, text, and code are protected by applicable intellectual property laws. You may use the website for personal and business purposes, but you may not copy, resell, or redistribute the website or its source code without permission.
terms.p.limitation_of_liability.1: To the maximum extent permitted by law, we are not liable for any indirect, incidental, special, consequential, or punitive damages arising from your use of the website or generated QR codes. You use the website at your own risk.
terms.p.overview.1: These Terms of Use govern your access to and use of this website and its tools, including the QR code generator. By using this website, you agree to these Terms. If you do not agree, please do not use the website.
terms.p.privacy_and_cookies.1: Our Privacy Statement explains how data is handled when you use the website. Our Cookie Policy explains how cookies are used, including analytics cookies that are enabled only with your consent.
terms.p.thirdparty_services.1: The website may rely on third-party services such as Cloudflare for hosting and delivery, and Google Analytics for analytics (only if you consent). We are not responsible for third-party services outside our control.
terms.p.what_this_website_provides.1: The website provides a client-side QR code generator. QR codes are generated in your browser. You are responsible for the content you encode and how you use the generated QR codes.
terms.p.your_content.1: You retain responsibility for any content you enter into the generator and any QR codes you produce. We do not verify the accuracy, legality, or safety of your encoded content.
